title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-13.3 - Supports
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-13.3 - Supports

State Regulations
(a) Horizontal-return boiler over 72 inches in diameter. A horizontal-return
tubular boiler over 72 inches in diameter shall be supported from steel hangers
by the outside suspension type of setting, independent of the boiler sidewalls. The hangers shall be so designed that the load is properly distributed between
the rivets attaching them to the shell and so that no more than two of these
rivets come in the same longitudinal line on each hanger. The distance
girthwise of the boiler from the centers of the bottom rivets to the centers of
the top rivets attaching the hangers shall be not less than 12 inches. The
other rivets used shall be spaced evenly between these points. If more than
four hangers are used they shall be set in four pairs. (b) Horizontal-return boilers 54 inches to 72
inches in diameter. A horizontal-return tubular boiler over 54 inches and up to
and including 72 inches in diameter shall be supported by the
outside-suspension type of setting or at four points by not less than eight
steel or cast-iron brackets set in pairs. (c) Horizontal-return boilers 54 inches in
diameter or less. A horizontal-return tubular boiler up to and including 54
inches in diameter shall be supported by the outside-suspension type of
setting, or by not less than two steel or cast-iron brackets on each
side. (d) Lugs and hangers. Lugs
and hangers, when used to support a boiler of any type, shall be properly
fitted to the surfaces to which they are attached. Where it is impractical to
attach them with rivets, studs with not less than 10 threads per inch may be
used. If lugs, hangers or brackets are attached by fusion welding, they shall
be attached by fillet welds along the entire periphery or contact edges, and
the throat dimension of the attachment welds shall be at least 0.7 times the
shell thickness. Notes
